    • Method Detail

      • bouncingScale

        public static javafx.animation.Animation bouncingScale(double startDelay,
                                                       double stepDuration,
                                                       double startScale,
                                                       double midScale,
                                                       double endScale,
                                                       javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> onFinished,
                                                       java.util.List<? extends javafx.scene.Node> nodes)
        Creates and returns scaling animation of given nodes in a sequential transition within two steps as follows;
        • First step: Scales node from startScale to midScale,
        • Second step: Scales node from midScale to endScale.
        Parameters:
        startDelay - Start delay in milliseconds.
        stepDuration - Step duration in milliseconds.
        startScale - Scaling factor at animation start.
        midScale - Scaling factor at the end of first animation step.
        endScale - Scaling factor at animation end.
        onFinished - Event handler to be notified when animation ends.
        nodes - List containing the animated nodes of the screen. Note that, nodes will be animated in given order.
        Returns:
        The newly created animation.

      • bouncingScale

        public static javafx.animation.Animation bouncingScale(double startDelay,
                                                       double stepDuration,
                                                       double startScale,
                                                       double midScale,
                                                       double endScale,
                                                       javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> onFinished,
                                                       javafx.scene.Node... nodes)
        Creates and returns scaling animation of given nodes in a sequential transition within two steps as follows;
        • First step: Scales node from startScale to midScale,
        • Second step: Scales node from midScale to endScale.
        Parameters:
        startDelay - Start delay in milliseconds.
        stepDuration - Step duration in milliseconds.
        startScale - Scaling factor at animation start.
        midScale - Scaling factor at the end of first animation step.
        endScale - Scaling factor at animation end.
        onFinished - Event handler to be notified when animation ends.
        nodes - Array containing the animated nodes of the screen. Note that, nodes will be animated in given order.
        Returns:
        The newly created animation.

      • fade

        public static javafx.animation.Animation fade(boolean isFadeIn,
                                              double startDelay,
                                              double stepDuration,
                                              javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> onFinished,
                                              javafx.scene.Node... nodes)
        Creates and returns sequential fade animation sequence.
        Parameters:
        isFadeIn - True to fade in, false for fade out.
        startDelay - Start delay in milliseconds.
        stepDuration - Step duration in milliseconds.
        onFinished - Event handler to be notified when animation ends.
        nodes - Array containing the animated nodes of the screen. Note that, nodes will be animated in given order.
        Returns:
        The newly created animation.

      • animateMainScreen

        public static void animateMainScreen(javafx.scene.layout.VBox inputPanel,
                                     javafx.scene.layout.VBox viewPanel,
                                     javafx.scene.layout.StackPane menuBarPanel,
                                     boolean enter,
                                     javafx.animation.Animation animation,
                                     javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> onFinished)
        Animates main screen.
        Parameters:
        inputPanel - Input panel.
        viewPanel - View panel.
        menuBarPanel - Menu bar panel.
        enter - True if components should enter the main screen.
        animation - Animation to be played in parallel to main screen animation. Can be null.
        onFinished - Event handler to be notified when animation ends. Can be null.
